statement: R(5,5) <= 48, i.e., every 2-coloring of E(K_49) contains a monochromatic K_5.
win_condition: Exhibit a 2-coloring of E(K_49) with no monochromatic K_5 subgraph (proving R(5,5) > 49).
background: R(5,5) >= 43 (Exoo 1989). R(5,5) <= 48 (Angeltveit-McKay 2017). The exact value is unknown. Best known lower bound constructions use Paley-type graphs and algebraic constructions.

strategy_suggestions.suggestion: Start from Paley-type constructions on GF(q) and try local modifications
strategy_suggestions.rationale: Paley graphs are the primary source of Ramsey lower bounds for diagonal cases

strategy_suggestions.suggestion: Consider flag algebra or SDP bounds to narrow the feasible region
strategy_suggestions.rationale: Razborov's flag algebra method has been effective for related problems
